words.definition: To accommodate is to have enough room.
words.example: The meeting room can accommodate nine people.

words.definition: A circus is a traveling show with animals and people.
words.example: I like to go to the circus to see the animals do tricks.

words.definition: If two things coincide, they happen at the same time.
words.example: My birthday coincides with Christmas.

words.definition: To commission someone to do something is to pay them to do it.
words.example: The artist was commissioned to create a picture.

words.definition: A dose is a certain amount of medicine that you take at one time.
words.example: The doctor gave me a dose of medicine.

words.definition: To dye something is to make it a certain color by using a special liquid.
words.example: She dyed her hair red.

words.definition: The extent of something is how large, important, or serious it is.
words.example: He didn't realize the extent of the damage.

words.definition: Gender is the condition of being male or female.
words.example: The form asks for your name, age, and gender.

words.definition: A headline is the title of a newspaper story that is printed in large letters.
words.example: The headline of the paper was about the election.

words.definition: If something is informal, it is not official or formal.
words.example: We had an informal meeting in the park.

words.definition: To inquire is to ask for information.
words.example: She called to inquire about the job.

words.definition: A messenger is a person who carries information from one place to another.
words.example: The messenger delivered the letter to the king.

words.definition: To peer is to look closely at something to see it better.
words.example: He peered through the window to see who was inside.

words.definition: A portrait is a painting or photograph of a person.
words.example: There was a portrait of the queen on the wall.

words.definition: To pose is to stand or sit in a certain way for a photograph or painting.
words.example: The family posed for a picture.

words.definition: A ranch is a large farm where animals like cows and horses are kept.
words.example: My uncle lives on a large ranch in Texas.

words.definition: To steer is to control the direction of a car, boat, or plane.
words.example: He steered the car through the narrow street.

words.definition: A stripe is a long, narrow line of color.
words.example: The zebra has black and white stripes.

words.definition: If an animal is tame, it is not afraid of people.
words.example: The bird was so tame that it sat on my hand.

words.definition: To tempt is to make someone want to have or do something.
words.example: The smell of the cake tempted me to eat a piece.
